issue.title: +server.js : "Content-Type: text/css" header set to "Content-Type: text/plain" in production, using Netlify-Adapter
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

In a `+server.js` file :

```
export async function GET() {
  return new Response(
   'body { background-color: green; }', 
   {
      headers: {
        'Content-Type': 'text/css'
      },
    }
  )
}
```
The "`Content-Type: text/css`" header seems to be changed to "`Content-type: text/plain`" in production, using Netlify-Adapter. (but it works in development mode)

### Reproduction

`git clone git@bitbucket.org:jymail/sveltekit-rendering-css.git`


### Logs

```shell
Response Headers :
  accept-ranges: bytes
  age: 19
  cache-control: public, max-age=0, must-revalidate
  content-length: 294
  content-type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
  server: Netlify
  strict-transport-security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload
  ...
```


### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: macOS 10.15.7
    CPU: (12) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-10600 CPU @ 3.30GHz
    Memory: 135.44 MB / 16.00 GB
    Shell: 5.7.1 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.16.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v16.16.0/bin/node
    npm: 8.13.2 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v16.16.0/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 104.0.5112.101
    Firefox: 103.0.2
    Safari: 15.6
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.69 
    @sveltejs/adapter-netlify: ^1.0.0-next.75 => 1.0.0-next.75 
    @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.449 
    svelte: ^3.44.0 => 3.49.0 
    vite: ^3.0.4 => 3.0.9
```


### Severity

blocking all usage of SvelteKit

### Additional Information

_No response_

body: This sounds extremely similar to https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/6412. Can you clarify the differences between the two?

in 6412 it sounded like it happens when using server.js file and netlify-adapter only on production.

for me it happens for adapter-node and on the client side of the +page.js file - its very similar but not quite completely. Reproducing my case above is easier as it happens locally

issue.title: Incorrect content-type parsing in actions

labels.name: forms
labels.description: Stuff relating to forms and form actions

milestone.description: stuff we need to nail down before launch

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When using a simple fetch to an endpoint like so:
```
fetch('/login', {method: "POST", body: new URLSearchParams('key', 'value')})
```

This is sent by Chrome and Safari as a POST request with the following content-type header:
```
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=UTF-8
```

But https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/packages/kit/src/runtime/server/page/actions.js checks the content-type value by splitting on `; ` (note the space). 

Therefore I cannot use the above fetch call because the endpoint returns:
> Actions expect form-encoded data (received application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=UTF-8)

I think this is a bug and that you should instead split on `;` (without space).

### Reproduction

Use a simple fetch to an endpoint (/login/+page.server.js) like so:
```
fetch('/login', {method: "POST", body: new URLSearchParams('key', 'value')})
```

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
any system
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: [fix] ensure serialized headers check is always applied
issue.body:
Closes #7112 - if we decide this is enough, and that we don't want some minimum whitelist. At least `content-type` seems like an easy win, and would save people some hassle - for example from https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/6412#issuecomment-1256817179 it seems that some libraries want the content type header.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

body: thank you very much, that actually fixed it. i would have never found this myself in the docs.
